p: The study sample collections were carried out in Kibera slum in Nairobi city and in rural Taita–Taveta County. Kibera slum is characterized by poor drainage, stagnant pools of water, congested and poorly litter, semi-permanent houses and a high human population density [ 22]. The rural Taita Hills area in Taita–Taveta County includes landscapes differing in altitude, vegetation and climate stretching over lowland savannah, Afromontane forested highlands and two national parks [ 23]. Taita–Taveta is traversed by new railway and road constructions and is proximal to the Kenyan coastline, which is known to have the highest prevalence of arboviral infections in Kenya [ 24].
